thread.title: New 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay admits she was 'heartbroken' over Nick Viall
thread.title_full: New 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay admits she was 'heartbroken' over Nick Viall

title: New 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay admits she was 'heartbroken' over Nick Viall
text:
New 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay admits she was 'heartbroken' over Nick Viall Erin Jensen, USA TODAY 9:53 a.m. ET Feb. 24, 2017 2 Shares 
New 'Bachelorette' Rachel Lindsay holds a gift from Ellen DeGeneres. (Photo: Michael Rozman/Warner Bros.) 
Historic Bachelorette Rachel Lindsay is ready to hand out rose boutonnieres sprinkled with her black girl magic on the upcoming season of the reality show, but admits she was devastated after being dismissed by Nick Viall on the current season of The Bachelor . 
The attorney opened up about the split that happened three months ago during Friday's episode of The Ellen DeGeneres Show . Lindsay admitted, like the daytime talk show host, she thought the two would end up together and was surprised when she was let go. 
"I was shocked too," Lindsay shared. "I really thought that Nick and I had a really strong connection, and I was pretty heartbroken when it happened, but I've moved on since then." We guess the thought of dozens of men competing for you while traveling the world helps. 
"I guess he was looking for something else," Lindsay reasoned. "His loss." 
Which begs the question: Who does Viall end up with? Though DeGeneres suspected Lindsay knew the winner, the Dallas native didn't offer up any hints. She did, however, stick up for this season's villain, Corinne Olympios, whom she professed her love for. 
"Unfortunately, you only get to see some sides of Corinne," Lindsay explained to DeGeneres. "I got to see all sides living in the house with her." 
For guys lining up to date Lindsay, know she's "a sucker for a great smile." 
"I'm looking for a guy who can make me laugh," she revealed. "I'm looking for a guy who knows exactly what he wants, who's ambitious, ready to start a family, ready to get married, 'cause I'm at that phase of my life." 
See how Lindsay's undoubtedly dramatic journey to find love unfolds when the new season of The Bachelorette premieres May 22. You can also check out her time on this season's Bachelor in our recaps below.
